entries.notes: TWO QUARTETS for two violins, viola and 'cello (arrangements of two quintets). No reference in Boccherini's autograph catalogue. These two quartets cannot be considered authentic. The arrangement, which is very correctly done, is the work of an unknown musician of the 18th century.

ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio, 22.5.6, 'Quartetto in re min . . .' and 'Quartetto in Si bem. Mag . . .'

entries.notes: Incorrectly attributed to Boccherini? Lost. Described by Picquot (p. 167) in the following words, which are our only source of information for this quartet: 'Quite recently, I received information of a quartet attributed to this composer, of which the motif is as follows:'

partial_notes: Entry 258 appears to continue on next page with additional information about the manuscript date and possession.
